Hey say a number
He edited his post; that's the problem. There's a 3 min window before you get the edit tag and you quoted him having a different number than he currently has.

It wasn't that, windows_x_seven didn't understand the override rule, so I told him to assume Deu's post are valid and respond to them Unless I told him that Deu was wrong.

I think he was referring to the fact that in your quote, windows' number is 33. In windows' quote, his number says 32. What gives?

He edited his post; that's the problem. There's a 3 min window before you get the edit tag and you quoted him having a different number than he currently has.

No no, I was quoting the post before that. He posted "go ahead" after every number for a while. at the top of that page he says "33 go ahead" if you click on the post that I originally quoted you will see that it goes to the right number.
Hey stop fighting and say a number mmkay

Click the little arrow in the quote in this post. http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/110598-The-Number-War-Count-to-100-or-100?p=1932949&viewfull=1#post1932949

It will take you to the right post. He posted both "33 go ahead" and "32 go ahead"
Say a number please mmkay

Oh XD, sorry, my mistake... just has been happening so often, and especially with people quoting the original numbers.

Just for future note; the last "update" on a post should count as the the intended post; but if someone makes a change when people are overriding to invalidate an override, or are posting in spam session and fixing the problems; it becomes a bit of a problem. I'm not saying we need to revert or shut down the game because it isn't "tactical" yet, I believe people are like me, and think they can edit it than others will notice.

But when someone quotes you having a different number it's a bit of an issue. Sure, the quotes can be faked, but it's just that people show there's a small problem going on that we can still address rationally.

Simply reply twice, the second reply, if you are actually fast, will appear below your post and should count as what you intended. If you aren't, then especially with the spam sessions, you can easily end up creating errors.

Edited May 12, 2015 by Fel
